sourceDesc.p: M.R. James, Descriptive Catalogue of the Manuscripts in the Library of Corpus Christi College, Cambridge 1912

projectDesc.p: The James Catalogue was digitized then marked up following the TEI P5 Guidelines. The customized model was provided by Giuliano Di Bacco, stored in an ODD file (parkerweb.xml): the latter was written by GDB using ROMA vers. 2.x, with manual adaptations. The ODD file is used as a source to compile the actual schema used to validate the xml: it is advisable to compile it in RelaxNG sintax (parkerweb.rnc) through ROMA.

msDesc.head: Formulary for Letter-writing
Formulae
msDesc.p: Vellum, 265 177 10.5 x 7, ff. 4 + 117 + 2, 51 etc. lines to a page. Cent. xiv, closely written in two main hands.
Collation: a4 (1 lines cover) 112-712 84 (4 canc.?) 96 | 108-128 | b2 (2 lines cover).
Flyleaves at the beginning (ff. iv-ivr) from a deed of 1526 (?) with notarial mark and device Sit laus deo. Those at the end (ff. vr-viv) from a large service-book of cent. xv.

msItem.incipit: Ad omnipotentis dei laudem gloriosius extollendam conseruandamque iocundius in linguis facundis hominum hoc floride dictaminis compendium studio iuuenili presento
msItem.rubric: Incipit capitulum primum de dictaminis partibus et ordine
msItem.incipit: Dictacio potest dici congrue dictorum disposicio
msItem.ab: The last formula of the first series is:
Most part of a blank page follows
A burlesque letter to a Christmas king headed:
msItem.rubric: Momentaneo principi Iohanni vocali sed non reali natalicio regi squalentis viculi de stokwalstret
msItem.incipit: Baltazar dan filius summi Jouis humane speciei singulare decus et gloria ac tocius inferioris mundi potentissimus imperator Johanni Regulo suburbano sordidissimi vici de stokwel stret
msItem.ab: Scriptum iiiito de Januarii assistente nobis regum et principum almi imperii nostri vassallorum multitudine copiosa
Serenissimo et placidissimo principi domino Johanni dei gratia Regi natalicio illustri de S. Teglet phalazar eadem gratia Iongobardorum rex
msItem.explicit: hirsutum efficiat Olofernem. Dat' Veneciis duodecimo die mensis Caslew in nostro regali palacio supra mare

msItem.rubric: Inter diuersa arcium documenta rethorice venustatis obseruanda sunt ornamenta
msItem.ab: Copies of letters begin on f. 23r
The lower part of f. 89v and all f. 90r are left blank
On f. 90v is a letter in the same hand written the reverse way of the page
ff. 91r-93v are in a smaller hand and contain letters: the first from the Dux Geldrie. Another to Adam Easton. These end f. 93v
In another hand of earlier type: brown ink. The lower part of ff. 94r-95v cut off
Letters. Those on ff. 94r-97v relate chiefly to a Bishop of Winchester
From f. 98r to f. 117r, they are all to or from Robert, Bishop of Salisbury
Copies of two letters in another hand. The first dated at Cawood

recordHist.p: markupCheck: checked by SP, BA, CF
